messages.subject: Re: My Mother and her rules...
messages.msgSnippet: Gardening nut here   What s an Earth Box? Lynda ... From: Aleasa J. Helsinger  Oh dear! My mother never allowed discussions of
messages.messageBody:
Gardening nut here <g> What's an "Earth Box?"

Lynda

----------
From: "Aleasa J. Helsinger" <leestore@...>

Oh dear! My mother never allowed discussions of religion or politics during
family gatherings or during the holidays....created too many bad feelings
in a matter of seconds that took years to repair.....are you all related to
me? She felt that their friendship was too valuable to risk over something
that had no true answer in a circle of more than one person. I have noted
before that this list is my MAIN line of support for UNschooling and I hate
to see it marred down with anger....

So......has anyone tried to garden with an "Earth Box"? They are quite
pricey but we love to try new things. Any info would be
helpfull........Thx, Aleasa

messages.subject: Re: My Mother and her rules...

writes:

<< How do you order the tomato seeds. That lil' project sounds like the kids
might enjoy this.My girls love to garden or I guess I should say dig and get
real dirty. <G>
>>


I am trying to confirm the correct email address and will get back to you
when I have it.

Nance

messages.messageBody:
How do you order the tomato seeds. That lil' project sounds like the kids might enjoy this.My girls love to garden or I guess I should say dig and get real dirty. <G>

TIA
Crystal
mom to Elizabeth 6/15/94
Katelyn 4/25/97
Lauren 11/4/98
-----Original Message-----
From: Marbleface@... <Marbleface@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, February 15, 2000 9:39 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] My Mother and her rules...


From: Marbleface@...

In a message dated 02/15/2000 1:44:18 PM !!!First Boot!!!, leestore@...
writes:

<< So......has anyone tried to garden with an "Earth Box"? They are quite
pricey but we love to try new things. Any info would be helpfull........Thx,
Aleasa
>>


No. We'll have to give it a look.

Last week, tho, we got our tomato seeds from NASA. Ones that have been up on
the shuttle and not and you are to plant and compare their growth, etc.

But then, the night after we planted, we had a huge rain and I think it
drowned the little seeds.

I am going to reorder (it's FREE!!!) and we'll give it another try.

Let's see, the lesson here was -- patience!! Mostly for Mom I htink.

Nance
